title: Clean Modern font for Medical website
content:
Hello everyone

What a great site and forum! This is my first post on this forum. MyFonts.com sent me here.

I am looking for a nice modern font that is formal and professional looking for titles on a medical website. I feel like I'm resigned to Arial or Verdana for the text on the site, so I can use common fonts, but I'd like the titles to be much more interesting. I'd like to have some "body" to the font...if that is a good word. This is a high tech site.

Thank anyone for a reply

Diane Sector
author: DSector

comments.content:
I'm not an expert on medical positioning, but I've often admired the clean and crisp look of Stefan Hattenbach's [Stalemate](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232840/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/stalemate.asp), available from Fountain. According to the website, Stalemate "was originally constructed as a proprietary font for a German IT-company." Moreover, it "was designed to work both in print and on screen and experience shows that it performs well in both environments." It could be just what you're looking for.

Here's a link to a [PDF sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232840/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/img/pdf/FTN_Stalemate.pdf) as well. Good luck!

Hi Diane,

First off, I'm not quite a professional yet, I'm a student, so my suggestions may not be 100%, but here they are anyways :) If you're going to be using a sans for the body copy, I'd recommend a serif font, or a sans with some character for the display type. Here's just a few of my suggestions…

Democratica if a quirky font that is modern/hi-tech, and I don't know it seems kinda 'medical' to me  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/democratica/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232840/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/democratica/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/democratica/")

Modern 735 is more conservative, but certainly is professional, and modern.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/modern-735/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232840/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/modern-735/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/modern-735/")

Kingsbury Conensed is interesting.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/kingsbury-condensed-sg/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232840/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/kingsbury-condensed-sg/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/kingsbury-condensed-sg/")

Ultra Bronzo is a sans, but has a good deal of character, fairly clean and high tech.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/thirstype/ultra-bronzo/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232840/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/thirstype/ultra-bronzo/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/thirstype/ultra-bronzo/")

Ditto with Copperplate Modern…  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/copperplate-modern/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232840/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/copperplate-modern/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/copperplate-modern/")
